Sorry for being so unspecific in my previous post. I want to develop a netw=
ork (with certain properties and constrains) that learns a sequence (or mul=
tiple sequences) during its lifetime. I think I will start with supervised =
learning, that is, the sequence is presented to the network (one or several=
 times) and the network should be able to reproduce the sequence when the b=
eginning of the sequence is presented. Of course the problem can be defined=
 in various ways and specified in more detail when sequence learning in an =
agent simulation or in a concrete problem domain is considered. 

Therefore=
, I would like to know which are the common problem domains that has been u=
sed in previous studies to investigate sequence learning during the lifetim=
e of the network. 

Best,
Martin 

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Ken" <ksta=
nley@...> wrote:
>
> 
> 
> Hi Martin, could you provide a little more info =
on what you mean by sequence learning?  Do you mean evolving a network to p=
erform a sequence of actions, or perhaps evolving a network that learns a s=
equence during its lifetime, or something else (such as learning the predic=
t the next value in a sequence)?
> 
> ken
> 
> --- In neat@yahoogroups.com,=
 "martin_pyka" <martin.pyka@> wrote:
> >
> > I would ask the community for =
good sequence learning problems that can be used to train neural networks. =
I think, a maze-navigation problem is probably a good starting point to stu=
dy sequence learning. But what other problems have been used in the literat=
ure to study sequence learning?
> > 
> > Best,
> > Martin
> >
>
